DataElement.preferredName: Radiation Oncology Imaging Based Contraindication Other Specify
DataElement.preferredDefinition: Text term not previously mentioned that represents the kind of radiation oncology contraindication based on the imaging report.

DataElementConcept.preferredName: Radiation Oncology Medical Imaging Basis Medical Contraindication
DataElementConcept.preferredDefinition: The study of the effects of ionizing radiation for treatment of tumors._Any technology which helps in visualization of any biological process, cell, tissue or organ for the screening, diagnosis, surgical procedure or therapy._The fundamental assumptions underlying an explanation or a relation that provide the foundation for something._A symptom or medical condition that makes a particular treatment or procedure inadvisable because a person is likely to have a bad reaction.

ObjectClass.preferredDefinition: A subspecialty of medical oncology and radiology concerned with the radiotherapy of cancer.

Concepts.definition: The study of the effects of ionizing radiation for treatment of tumors.

Property.preferredDefinition: In medicine, any technology which helps in visualization of any biological process, cell, tissue or organ for the screening, diagnosis, surgical procedure or therapy.:The fundamental assumptions underlying an explanation or a relation that provide the foundation for something.:Any special symptom or circumstance that renders the use of a remedy or the carrying out of a procedure inadvisable, usually because of the risk.

Concepts.definition: In medicine, any technology which helps in visualization of any biological process, cell, tissue or organ for the screening, diagnosis, surgical procedure or therapy.
The fundamental assumptions underlying an explanation or a relation that provide the foundation for something.
A symptom or medical condition that makes a particular treatment or procedure inadvisable because a person is likely to have a bad reaction.

ConceptualDomain.preferredDefinition: actions or administration of therapeutic agents to produce an effect that is intended to alter the course of a pathologic process (NCI).
